des:
Thanks to ZenVoice your KNX smarthome is integrated with Alexa voice assistant. If you have a KNX installation you can now enjoy this functionality that will make your home smarter. Zennio’s control interface is as intuitive as having a Z70 touch panel or a similar device that interfaces your KNX installation with your Alexa assistant. Don’t forget to say: Alexa, thank Zennio for making my life easier!


Previous requirements:

1. A KNX installation, having at least a Z70 touch panel or a similar device with at least one on/off light control.
2. Zennio Remote mobile app installed.
3. Register in Zennio Remote mobile app.
4. Pair your Z70 touch panel or similar device with Zennio Remote mobile app.
5. Set the desired controls of your Z70 touch panel or similar device as Alexa controllable devices at ZenVoice website: https://zenvoice.zennioapps.com/

Instructions:

- Select the “Enable skill” button in the Alexa app.
- Enter your Zennio account (obtained in requirement 3) in the view that will appear later.
- Once you access, you can start detecting devices of your Z70 touch panel or similar device in the Alexa app.


To use the skill, you need names set for your devices. There are two ways to define these names:

- Use the names you previously configured in the ZenVoice web app (requirement 5).
- or create an Alexa group, such as Bedroom or Living Room, and add the device to the group. More info: https://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=hp_left_v4_sib?ie=UTF8&nodeId=201749250


Voice control. Once you know the name, or group name, of your device, you can say phrases like:

“Alexa, turn off the bathroom light.”
“Alexa, turn on the living room light.”


If you have any question, please visit: https://www.zennio.com/faqs-zenvoice-en
or write to Zennio support mail address: soporte@zennio.com

More general info about connecting smart home devices to Alexa at: https://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=hp_left_v4_sib?nodeId=201749240
